CatDescriptText: Herschel Lisby, railway mail clerk, Route 1, Rushville, Indiana, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the increasing demand for father and mother to work, thus taking both parents out of the home for the better part of the day, affects their children as regards discipline, ambition, and social compatibility in general?" answer reads: "Absolutely.  It affects the discipline and outlook on life.  It is natural for the child to want a mother's care.  It is necessary that the mother be there to teach and the father be there to wield the discipline in home."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Herschel Lisby, wearing fedora, patterned necktie, and overcoat, standing with hands in pockets on sidewalk in front of stone building with store windows on either side, one on left with clock that reads 2:20, one on right with sign that reads "Sale Top Coats..."
